definition: Dong Biwu (1886-1975), one of the founders of the Chinese communist party
surname Dong
to supervise/to direct/director
certainly/must/will/necessarily
surname Wu
martial/military

sentences.english: In implementing the policy of building of democracy, Dong Biwu attaches great importance to the relation between party and the people's government.
sentences.chinese: 在实行民主建政中，董必武十分重视党和政府的关系。

sentences.english: The socialism legal perspective of Dong Biwu put its emphasis on the point of obeying the law.
sentences.chinese: 董必武的社会主义法制观重点体现在依法办事上。

sentences.english: Dong's law thought still has practical and immediate significance for today's China.
sentences.chinese: 董必武法学思想在当代中国仍然具有重要的现实意义。

sentences.english: Dong Biwu has made great contribution to China's legal system.
sentences.chinese: 董必武为新中国法制建设作出了重要贡献。

sentences.english: Dong Biwu was one of chief leaders in the public security, procuratorial and judicial work in New China.
sentences.chinese: 董必武是新中国在政法工作方面的主要领导人之一。

sentences.english: The content of Dong Biwu's legal system thought is quite abundant.
sentences.chinese: 董必武的法制思想，其内容相当丰富。

definition: Liu Shaoqi (1898-1969), Chinese communist leader, a martyr of the Cultural Revolution

Zhu De (1886-1976), communist leader and founder of the People's Liberation Army

Zhang Wentian (1900-1976), CCP party leader and theorist
Hu Yaobang (1915-1989), Chinese politician
Mao Zedong (1893-1976), Chinese communist leader
Yang Shangkun (1907-1998), former president of PRC and military leader
Wu Yuzhang (1878-1966), writer, educator and communist politician
Chen Yi (1901-1972), communist general and politician, Marshal of PLA from 1955, Mayor of Shanghai in 1950s, PRC foreign minister 1958-1972
Deng Yingchao (1904-1992), Chinese communist leader, wife of Zhou Enlai 周恩來|周恩来
Chairman Mao/Mao Zedong 毛澤東|毛泽东 (1893-1976), Chinese Communist leader
Premier Zhou Enlai 周恩來|周恩来 (1898-1976)
Bo Yibo (1908-2007), ranking PRC politician, served on State Council from 1950s to 1980s as colleague of Deng Xiaoping
Luo Ronghuan (1902-1963), Chinese communist military leader
